intro: Biauricula saxatilis, commonly known as the rock bellflower, is a flowering plant native to rocky and alpine environments in Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in crevices and on rocky slopes, adapting to harsh, well-drained soils. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms in late summer. Biauricula saxatilis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
